channel.title: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor
channel.description:
Current Circle of Death:
Everyone visiting target player will die. (Unavailable before Night 5)
Change to:
Circle of Death
2 people visiting your target will die unless there are 3 or more people visiting. Pierces night immunity. If the Inquisitor visits the target, he will be the priority to be killed and will bypasses Guarding and Healing on the Inquisitor only. If used on the Inquisitor, he will die bypassing Guarding/Healing. No other visitors will die. (Unavailable until Night 3)
Limited to 3 uses.

item.source: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor

item.title: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Ulkesh
item.description:
If you have strong clues that you’ve found the Inquisitor, it will be more than worth it!
Being found and killed by the Inquisitor is an instant loss for the Sorcerer after all. Removing that risk by 1 extra attack at night may grant him several days of extra time.

If someone encourages to put some suspect up and that suspect ends up claiming Court Wizard on the stand… What does that say about the person that put him up there? Could very well be an investigative BD, but if you decide to attack him (BD needs to die!) and he lives… well… Why would someone with some form of immunity have reasons to put someone with magic ability on the stand? Well worth a shot in this case I would say.

And again, chances are the Inquisitor already lost his Night Immunity because someone else attacked him earlier. In this case, only one attack from the Sorcerer kills him. (checks in-game if Inquisitor is male… confirmed )

Read full topic

item.description:

item.source: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor

item.title: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
Still think it’s unlikely that sorcerer will waste a kill on a night immune target twice - especially with the fact every day that passes means it’s more likely they will die and lose

Read full topic
item.source: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor

item.title: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Ulkesh
item.description:
@Moleland
Of course it does! They survived! This will start your deduction. Could it be the Inquisitor? Or a Scorned? Perhaps the Mastermind or an Alchemist?

The attack itself won’t tell you anything else, but information should not be handed on a silver platter. Deduction is part of the game.

Was there a Trollbox ever used? You now must consider that the person you attacked could be Scorned.
That would be a waste of a valuable night attacking him again. Perhaps what he said in chat might steer towards getting someone exed. Makes Scorned more likely again. In this case, you could consider attacking a target that is likely a Blue Dragon. (again, you don’t have to kill the Inquisitor)

Did someone claim that target was immune to occupy? Also a clue to him being Scorned or a guarded BD that is occupy immune.

I would really hate it if this game was ever to come down to just check results: 100% A or 100% B.
Or random killings.

@Lily
Lol, right you are! Weird she isn’t called a Sorceress!

Read full topic

Read full topic
item.source: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor

item.title: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Ulkesh
item.description:
@Moleland

That is not a problem at all, that is an interesting choice (backed by some level of deduction) you give to the sorcerer.

If the Sorcerer knew for sure that an immune target would be the Inquisitor, it would be far too simple. So he has to pay attention to signals from chat, whispers and voting. Yes, he will be in a disadvantage in the race to find the other, because of the abilities the Inquisitor has. (investigative and the one-time immunity)

But keep in mind, this is not the Sorcerer’s primary race! His win condition is not to kill the Inquisitor. If he has some leads presented to him, he can choose to spend some effort there, because killing the Inquisitor will make his life a lot easier. But his goal is to survive and kill the Blue Dragon!

Also, the Inquisitor can be attacked by other sources, like Alchemist, Knight or Cult Leader. This will also remove his Immunity to death at night. So it is not nearly as bad as you describe.

Read full topic

item.title: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor

item.description:
The problem there is you are expecting sorcerer to try killing an immune target twice in a row, when it can easily be scorned/alch/MM or guarded by King.

item.source: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor

item.title: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Ulkesh
item.description:
@KyoDaz

Uhm… No? I can’t see why that would be the case with my suggestion.

Both your suggestion and mine can cause the Inquisitor to die earlier in the game. (for balance reasons I think we agree on)

Mine is just adding one word to an existing passive. Your suggestion means making an ability with 3 lines filled with information just to have it kill the Inquisitor. I don’t like that much text/info on abilities.

Read full topic

item.source: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor

item.title: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Ulkesh
item.description:
I would like to see the Immune to death at night replaced by the old Priest passive:

Immune to death at night once

I would much prefer this above the suggestion of making the Inquisitor ‘not immune to Sorcerer’.

Now a killer class (knights included) has to deduce: Was it the Mastermind, an Alchemist with stoneskin, the Inquisitor?

item.title: Sorcerer needs more power to kill Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: WutangRZA
item.description:
This would be a solid change. I’d also like to see the Sorc’s win condition changed to “See the inquisitor die before you”

Right now Inquis is an honorary BD with permanent death immunity and Sorc is an Unseen that doesn’t get the win if he dies before they win.
